Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that authorities found 39 missing children in Georgia, but not all in one location and not in a "double wide trailer."
Understate: The claim understates the coverage of the story, as it suggests that it is not the "biggest news story in America" when in fact it was covered by numerous news organizations.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or sources to back up the claim that authorities found 39 children in a double wide trailer.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that the story should be the "biggest news story in America," which is subjective and not based on factual evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim as authorities did find 39 missing children in Georgia, but not in a trailer and not all in the same location.
